meanings.definition: A public record, survey, or map of the value, extent, and ownership of land for taxation.
meanings.sent1: The cadastres showed the boundaries of each land plot clearly.
meanings.sent2: The government used the cadastres to determine property taxes.
meanings.sent3: The cadastres were so detailed, they even included the number of trees on each property.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a complex network of cadastres, mapping out every memory and thought.
meanings.sent5: The cadastres were like a treasure map, revealing the hidden wealth of the landowners.

meanings.definition: A register of the real property of a country, district, or city, with the value and ownership of the property.
meanings.sent1: The cadastres listed all the houses and their owners in the city.
meanings.sent2: People referred to the cadastres to confirm property ownership.
meanings.sent3: The cadastres read like a fascinating story of land and ownership.
meanings.sent4: His heart was a cadastres of emotions, each one carefully documented and labeled.
meanings.sent5: The cadastres whispered the secrets of land ownership to those who could decipher them.
